CODING.description: The user has specifically requested that the LLM produce code, and the next response is best handled by a code-completion LLM that is skilled only in writing code or scripts. This model is not equipped to discuss technical topics or software design/ideas. It is only skilled at writing code

FACTUAL.description: The user has asked a question that the answer would be factual in nature, meaning that the next response is best handled by an LLM that specialized in RAG and has access to wikipedia (This can mean the response is related to specific animals, insects, locations, history, famous people, or any other topic that would exist on Wikipedia)

REASONING.description: An appropriate response would require a high level of reasoning, such as solving puzzles, drawing conclusions or making predictions, and is best suited to be handled by an LLM that has a lengthy response time and thinks through the problem completely

MATH.description: The user is specifically discussing a math related topic that requires advanced knowledge of math to respond, and the next response is best handled by an LLM that specializes in solving math problems

OTHER.description: An appropriate response does not fit into any of the other categories. This LLM is skilled in a wide range of topics, including technical discussion, software design, UX, general conversation and banter.
